Morgan Securities, the successor \uFB01rm to Bear Stearns & Co Inc. She joined the original \uFB01rm in 1988, and prior to that had worked for seven years at Smith Barney Harris Upham & Co, Inc. Gwen graduated from the U of R in 1965 with a degree in French Literature and did her graduate work at NYU. Gwen had a varied - but never dull career! She had planned to teach, but since New York City schools were on strike at the time, she instead went to work at Dun & Bradstreet as a credit reporter and then to DLJ in research/arbitrage. Subsequently, Gwen joined Mayor John Lindsay's administration, as Director of Tourism for the City of New York, where they originated the ubiquitous street fairs that take over during the summer months. Then Gwen went into television news, as a producer and reporter; and subsequently she returned to Dun & Bradstreet for several years, and in 1981 began her current career in Finance. Gwen serves on the Board of Trustees at the U of R, where she is Chairman of the Student Life Committee and chairs the Annual Fund for the entire University. Additionally, she endows a scholarship for an entering female, and also a prize for a graduating senior who is a First Generation student and best exempli\uFB01es the notion of excellence and commitment both inside and outside the classroom. In 2011, Gwen was honored with the naming of the Gwen M. Greene Center for Career Education and Connections, in recognition of all she has done to further the careers of both students and alumni. Gwen just \uFB01nished her term as Chairman of the Board of 'She's the First', a non-pro\uFB01t that seeks to educate girls in low income countries to be the \uFB01rst in their family to receive a secondary school education; she was honored last Fall as their Mentor of the Year. import React, { Component } from 'react' export default class EventDetail extends Component { render() { return (
Demystifying Wall Street

September 2nd, Wednesday, 7PM

Gwen is a Vice President/Financial Advisor at J.P. Morgan Securities, the successor ﬁrm to Bear Stearns & Co Inc. She joined the original ﬁrm in 1988, and prior to that had worked for seven years at Smith Barney Harris Upham & Co, Inc. Gwen graduated from the U of R in 1965 with a degree in French Literature and did her graduate work at NYU. Gwen had a varied - but never dull career! She had planned to teach, but since New York City schools were on strike at the time, she instead went to work at Dun & Bradstreet as a credit reporter and then to DLJ in research/arbitrage. Subsequently, Gwen joined Mayor John Lindsay's administration, as Director of Tourism for the City of New York, where they originated the ubiquitous street fairs that take over during the summer months. Then Gwen went into television news, as a producer and reporter; and subsequently she returned to Dun & Bradstreet for several years, and in 1981 began her current career in Finance. Gwen serves on the Board of Trustees at the U of R, where she is Chairman of the Student Life Committee and chairs the Annual Fund for the entire University. Additionally, she endows a scholarship for an entering female, and also a prize for a graduating senior who is a First Generation student and best exempliﬁes the notion of excellence and commitment both inside and outside the classroom. In 2011, Gwen was honored with the naming of the Gwen M. Greene Center for Career Education and Connections, in recognition of all she has done to further the careers of both students and alumni. Gwen just ﬁnished her term as Chairman of the Board of 'She's the First', a non-proﬁt that seeks to educate girls in low income countries to be the ﬁrst in their family to receive a secondary school education; she was honored last Fall as their Mentor of the Year. The organization seeks to develop the next generation of leaders both abroad and at US high schools and colleges, including the chapter at the U of R. Gwen also serves on the Board of the Cinema Arts Center in Millerton, NY, a multi screen Moviehouse dedicated to bringing the best in film to the Hudson Valley

Stream the session here on September 2nd, Wednesday, 7PM

View on YouTube

View on Facebook
